Issues.Title: Build produces *wpftmp* folder for every application.
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1166456/build-produces-wpftmp-folder-for-every-application.html)._ --- [severity:I'm frustrated, but able to complete my work] We have a solution with around 250 projects. There are around 15 projects in it the produce a console or wpf application. With one of the latest updates we now get for every build an automatically generated folder with the "_wpftmp" extension. For example if the is called Test you get the folder "Test_{some random number}_wpftmp". The folder is left empty. This is really annoying since I have many unused folders in my target output. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 8/28/2020, 03:54 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### Sara Liu [MSFT] on 8/30/2020, 08:15 PM:

Dear customer, thank you for your feedback and I am sorry to hear that you are running into this issue.
Does this folder is under the solution root folder or each project folder? Would you please help to check this issue happens to this specific solution or all solutions? I tried to create some solutions to test it, but unable to reproduce this issue in VS 2019 16.8 Preview 2.

#### msedi on 8/31/2020, 10:02 AM: Yes, I can see it in Preview 2 and also in productive VS2019. So it's not a problem of the Preview.

I think it is also related to here: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/210156/msbuild-is-adding-a-random-hash-and-wpftmp-to-my-a.html.

I'm not sure if it has to do with our build configuration, but it's a pretty simple one. #### Ryland Alaniz [MSFT] on 8/31/2020, 11:41 AM:

Is the project targeting .NET Framework or .NET Core? Which version? Thanks.

#### Martin Sedlmair on 8/31/2020, 02:22 PM:

Sorry, I thought you can can derive this from the attached log files. It is a .NET Core project 

<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>WinExe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>net5.0</TargetFramework>
    <UseWPF>true</UseWPF>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>

We have indeed a few specialities, like we are using the Directory.Build.props recursively, we redirect the OutputPath/OutputDir and the IntermediatePath.

It is only for projects with XAML/WPF. All others do not show this problem. It is also completely undeterminstic to me when the folder is created.

I would recreate this issue with a simple project, but since all apps and libraries are part of a very large solution I'm not sure if I can easily create a small repro solution.

#### msedi on 9/1/2020, 00:40 AM:

Sorry, it should be a netcoreapp3.1 and not net5.0.

#### msedi on 9/8/2020, 03:50 AM:

Any news on this?

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Build produces *wpftmp* folder for every application." (#3616)

Issues.Title: Allow setting Grid.Row/Grid.Column by Name
Issues.Body:
Right now, Grid.Row/Grid.Column use an integer to set the location of the control. During Grid.RowDefinitions/Grid.ColumnDefinitions it's possible to set a name as well as Height/Width.

When adding another row/column to the definitions, all the rows/columns can become offset leading to finding each Grid.Row/Grid.Column and manually changing them to the new offset. If we could use name instead of index, we could avoid this issue.

The current solutions are unwieldy, so having this in the base would be ideal.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow setting Grid.Row/Grid.Column by Name" (#3614)

Issues.Title: Recent 16.7.5 (with SDK 3.1.402) has build issue with WPF project file
Issues.Body:
Visual Studio 16.7.5 and SDK 3.1.402 seem to have an issue/bug (WPF project file will just NOT compile: 
> error MC1000: Unkown build error, "Could not find type 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.DesignTimeProviderServicesAttribute' ..."
).

At first sight this had some similarity with #3312 as the file 

- C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.402\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(225,9)

is causing the trouble here as well; however, the message in this case reads 'Could not find type' instead.

_Originally posted by @tomdierkes in https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/3312#issuecomment-704952217_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Recent 16.7.5 (with SDK 3.1.402) has build issue with WPF project file " (#3613)

Issues.Title: Fix the casing of 'Shared' in WpfSharedDir
Issues.Body:
The value was specified with a lower case 's', but the directory in Git is spelt with a capital 'S'. This discrepancy causes failures on source server lookups. For example, stepping into `MS.Utility.FrugalList` tries to load (using .NET 5.0 RC1):

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/wpf/be89bbfaded6ad3f0f4143bf1a8dd075a5789715/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/shared/MS/Utility/FrugalList.cs

but the server returns a 404 response. The source is actually at:

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/wpf/be89bbfaded6ad3f0f4143bf1a8dd075a5789715/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Shared/MS/Utility/FrugalList.cs

Issues.Title: Border contrast failures in High Contrast White
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.402
* Windows version: 10H2 19042.508
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
As called out in Section 1.4.11 of https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG21/, adjacent colors of non-text elements need to have a minimum contrast of 3.0. WPF satisfies this requirement in all modes except High Contrast White, where the gradient brush used for control borders goes from Black (0, 0, 0). to a gray (192, 192, 192). The contrast of the gray to the white background (255, 255, 255) is about 1.82, which fails the requirement. Here's a screenshot showing the failures in High Contrast White mode--it's intentionally zoomed to make it easier to see the contrast issue on the bottom and right sides of the controls, some of which are highlighted with red arrows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45672944/95115949-24ddb680-06fb-11eb-9bf6-5531e19f7c52.png)

This pattern occurs with radiobuttons, textboxes, checkboxes, and comboboxes, and probably other control types.

The simplest fix here is to draw the borders with a solid black brush--in the Black-based High Contrast modes, the borders are drawn with a solid white brush, and they work just fine.

I'm aware that it's possible to style the control borders, but the default behavior of the framework should comply with the basic contrast requirements.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
 **Minimal repro:**
[WpfTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5329332/WpfTest.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Border contrast failures in High Contrast White" (#3610)

Issues.Title: Loss of blurry background of windows on resizing with SetWindowCompositionAttribute and windows 10 v2004 in WPF
Issues.Body:
Hello,
In a WPF program, I used a blurry background for my windows.
I created this blur using the SetWindowCompositionAttribute API.
This effect worked very well
The version of the Framework used is 4.7. 2.

Since updating Windows 10 to version 2004, I have seen issues with losing the blur effect when resizing windows size and after resizing when I start mouse clicking on the desktop and on the windows (loss of the random blur effect).
This loss of the blur effect occurs when there are at least 2 windows displayed with the blur effect on the same screen.

I also had to move the SetWindowCompositionAttribute API call from the Initialized event to the Load event of the window to have a blurry effect when opening the window.

During my tests, I used Framework 4.8 and core 3.1 in C #, it doesn't change anything.

I have attached a zip file in which you can see these problems on the 2 videos and test using the program.
[BLURBEHIND.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5322049/BLURBEHIND.zip)

![Blurred](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66659162/94998177-277fc500-05b0-11eb-98bc-16286a7e0810.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Loss of blurry background of windows on resizing with SetWindowCompositionAttribute and windows 10 v2004 in WPF" (#3608)

Issues.Title: Unable to identify scroll bar "Page down" or other internal scroll bar object using UIAutomation
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`): 3.0.1.302
* Windows version: (`winver`): Windows 10/Windows Server 2012/ Windows Server 2016
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 
We are automating windows Desktop applications using UIAutomation library. We were using net472 previously and now switched to .net core 3.1.

csproj file entries:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> 
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop"> 
  <PropertyGroup> 
    <OutputType>Library</OutputType> 
    <TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp3.1</TargetFrameworks> 
    <UseWPF>true</UseWPF> 
    <UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms>
We are using the following code to identify the objects at runtime using UIAutomation library.

using System.Windows.Automation;
PropertyCondition condition=new PropertyCondition(AutomationElement.NameProperty, nameOfObject)
AutomationElementCollection collection=windowElement.FindAll(TreeScope.Descendants, condition); 
Most of the objects are working but the objects inside the scroll bar are not identifiable using code.
[WindowsFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5303322/WindowsFormsApp1.zip)
[NetCoreSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5303324/NetCoreSample.zip)
[netframeworkCode.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5303325/netframeworkCode.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to identify scroll bar "Page down" or other internal scroll bar object using UIAutomation" (#3597)
